gurmukhi: ਖਿਮੰਤ ਤੇਗ ਅੈਸ ਕੈ ॥ ਜੁਲੰਤ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ਜੈਸ ਕੈ ॥ ਹਸੰਤ ਜੇਮ ਕਾਮਣੰ ॥ ਖਿਮੰਤ ਜਾਣ ਦਾਮਣੰ ॥੪੭੫॥
transliteration: Khimant Teg Ais Kai|| Julant Jvaal Jais Kai|| Hasant Jem Kaamanndng|| Khimant Jaan Daamanndng||475||
translation: The swords are glistening like the fires or like the smiling damsels or like the flashing lightning.475.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੰਤ ਦਾੲਿ ਘਾੲਿਣੰ ॥ ਚਲੰਤ ਚਿਤ ਚਾੲਿਣੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੰਤ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗ ੲਿੳੁ ॥ ਬਨੇ ਸੁ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ਜਾਲ ਜਿੳੁ ॥੪੭੬॥
transliteration: Bahant Daae Ghaaenan|| Chalant Hit Chaaenan|| Girant An Bhan Io|| Bade Su Jvaal Jaal Jio||476||
translation: While inflicting wounds, they are moving like the restless modifications of mind; the broken limbs are falling like meteors.476.

gurmukhi: ਹਸੰਤ ਖੇਤ ਖੱਪਰੀ ॥ ਭਕੰਤ ਭੂਤ ਭੈ ਧਰੀ ॥ ਖਿਮੰਤ ਜੇਮ ਦਾਮਣੀ ॥ ਨਚੰਤ ਹੇਰ ਕਾਮਣੀ ॥੪੭੭॥
transliteration: Hasant Kht Khapdaree|| Bhakant Bhoot Bhai Ddaree|| Khimant Jem Daamannde|| Nachannd He Kaamannde||477||
translation: The goddess Kalika is laughing in the battlefield and the frightening ghosts are shouting; just as the lightning is flashing, In the same manner, the heavenly damsels are looking at the battlefield and dancing.477.

gurmukhi: ਹਹੰਕ ਭੈਰਵੀ ਸੁਰੀ ॥ ਕਹੰਕ ਸਾਧ ਸਿੱਧਰੀ ॥ ਛਲੰਕ ਛਿੱਛ ੲਿੱਛਣੀ ॥ ਬਹੰਤ ਤੇਗ ਤਿੱਛਣੀ ॥੪੭੮॥
transliteration: Hahank Bharvisuree|| Kahank Saadh Sidddaree|| Chhalank Chhichchh Ichchhcnee|| Bahant Teg Tichchhanee||478||
translation: Bhairavi is shouting and the yoginis are laughing ; the sharp swords fulfilling the desires, are striking the blows.478.

gurmukhi: ਗਣੰਤ ਗੂੜ ਗੰਭਰੀ ॥ ਸੁਭੰਤ ਸਿੱਪ ਸੌ ਭਰੀ ਚਲੇਤ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਚਾਪਣੀ ॥ ਜਪੰਤ ਜਾਪ ਜਾਪਣੀ ॥੪੭੯॥
transliteration: Gadant Good Gadbharee|| Soubhant Sipp Sau Bharee|| Chalet Chitra Chaapanee|| Jpant Jaap Jaapanee||479||
translation: The goddess Kali is seriously enumerating the corpses and filling her bowl with blood, is looking magnificent; she is moving carelessly and seems like a portrait; she is repeating the Lord’s Name.479.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਅੰਤ ਸੀਸ ੲੀਸਣੀ ॥ ਹਸੰਤ ਹਾਰ ਸੀਸਣੀ ॥ ਕਰੰਤ ਪ੍ਰੇਤ ਨਿੱਸਨੰ ॥ ਅਗੰਮ ਗੰਮ ਭਿਓ ਰਣੰ ॥੪੮੦॥
transliteration: Puant Sees Eesanee|| Hasant Haar Seesadee|| Karant Prêt Nissanan|| Agadm Gadm Bheo Ranan||480||
translation: She is stringing the rosary of skulls and putting it around her neck, she is laughing; the ghosts are also visible there and the battlefield has become an unapproachable place.480.

gurmukhi: ਜਬੈ ਜੰਗ ਜੰਗੀ ਕਰਿਓ ਜੰਗ ਜੋਰੰ ॥ ਹਨੇ ਬੀਰ ਬੰਕੇ ਤਮੰ ਜਾਣ ਭੋਰੰ ॥ ਤਬੈ ਕੋਪ ਗਰਜਿਓ ਕਲਕੀ ਅਵਤਾਰੰ ॥ ਸਜੇ ਸਰਬ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਧਸਿਓ ਲੋਹ ਧਾਰੰ ॥੪੮੧॥
transliteration: Jabai Jan Janikario Jan Joran|| Hane Beer Banke Tamannd Jaan Bhoran|| Tabai Kop Gadjio Kalki Avtaaran|| Saje Sarab Shastran Dhasio Loh Dhaaran||481||
translation: When the warriors waged a powerful war, many elegant fighters were killed; then Kalki thundered and bedecked with all the weapons, penetrated into the current of steel-weapons.481.

gurmukhi: ਜਯਾ ਸ਼ਬਦ ੳੁਠੇ ਰਹੇ ਲੋਗ ਭੂਰੰ ॥ ਖੁਰੰ ਖੇਹ ੳੁਠੀ ਛੁਹੀ ਜਾੲਿ ਸੂਰੰ ॥ ਛੁਟੈ ਸ੍ਵਰਨ ਪੰਖੰ ਭੲਿਓ ਅੰਧਕਾਰੰ ॥ ਅੰਧਾ ਧੁੰਧ ਮੱਚੀ ੳੁਠੀ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਝਾਰੰ ॥੪੮੨॥
transliteration: Jayaa Shabad Outhe Rahe Log Bhooran|| Khuran Kheh Outhi Chhuhijaae Sooran|| Chhoutai Svaran Machchiouthishastra Jhaaran||482||
translation: There was such a thundering sound that the people were absorbed in the illusion and the dust of the horses’ feet arose high to touch the sky; because of the dust, the golden rays disappeared and the darkness prevailed; in that confusion, there was a showe

gurmukhi: ਹਣਿਓ ਜੋਰ ਜੰਗੰ ਭਜਿਓ ਸਰਬ ਸੈਣੰ ॥ ਤ੍ਰਿਣੰ ਦੰਤ ਥਾਂਭੈ ਬਕੈ ਦੀਨ ਬੈਣੰ ॥ ਮਿਲੇ ਦੈ ਅਕੋਰੰ ਨਿਹੋਰੰਤ ਰਾਜੰ ॥ ਭਜੇ ਗਰਬ ਗਰਬੰ ਤਜੇ ਰਾਜ ਸਾਜੰ ॥੪੮੩॥
transliteration: Hanio Jor Janadg Bhajio Sarab Sainan|| Trinan Dant Thaandhai Bakai Deen Bainan|| Mile Dai Akoran Nihorant Raajan|| Bhaje Gadah Gadaban Taje Raaj Saajan||483||
translation: In that dreadful war, the army, being destroyed, ran away and pressing straw between the teeth, it began to shout with humility; seeing this the king also abandoned his pride and ran away leaving behind his kingdom and all his paraphernalia.483.

gurmukhi: ਕਟੇ ਕਾਸ਼ਮੀਰੀ ਹਠੇ ਕਸ਼ਟਵਾਰੀ ॥ ਕੁਪੇ ਕਾਸ਼ਕਾਰੀ ਬਡੇ ਛਤ੍ਰਧਾਰੀ ॥ ਬਲੀ ਬੰਗਸੀ ਗੋਰਬੰਦੀ ਗ੍ਰਦੇਜੀ ॥ ਮਹਾ ਮੂੜ ਮਾਜਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਰਾਨੀ ਮਜੇਜੀ ॥੪੮੪॥
transliteration: Kate Kaadhmeerihathe Kashatvdaree|| Koupe Kaadhkaaribade Chhatradhdaree|| Balibanadigorbandigradejee|| Mahaa Moond Maajindra Raanimajejee||484||
translation: Many Kashmiri and patient, persistent and enduring warriors were chopped and killed and many canopied; many mighty Gurdezi fighters and fighters of other countries, who were siding that king with great foolishness, were defeated.484.

gurmukhi: ਹਣੇ ਰੂਸ ਤੂਸੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਤੀ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਜੋਧੀ ॥ ਹਠੇ ਪਾਰਸੁੱਯਦ ਸੁ ਖੂਬਾਂ ਸਕ੍ਰੋਧੀ ॥ ਬੁਰੋ ਬਾਗਦਾਬੀ ਸਿਪਾਹਾ ਕੰਧਾਰੀ ॥ ਕੁਲੀ ਕਾਲਮਾਛਾ ਛੁਭੇ ਛਤ੍ਰਧਾਰੀ ॥੪੮੫॥
transliteration: Hane Roos Toosikritichitra Jodhee|| Hathe Paarsuyyad Su Khoobaan Sakrodhee|| Buro Baagdaabisipaahaa Kandhdaree|| Kulikaalmaachhaadchhoubhe Chhatradhdaree||485||
translation: The Russians,Turkistanis, Sayyads and other persistent and angry fighters were killed; the dreadful fighting soldiers of Kandhar and many other canopied and angry warriors were also made lifeless.485.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੇ ਬਾਣ ਗੋਲੰ ੳੁਠੇ ਅੱਗ ਨਾਲੰ ॥ ਘੁਰੇ ਜਾਣ ਸਯਾਮੰ ਘਟਾ ਜਿਮ ਜ੍ਵਾਲੰ ॥ ਨਚੇ ੲੀਸ ਸੀਸੰ ਪੁਅੈ ਰੁੰਡ ਮਾਲੰ ॥ ਜੁਝੇ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ਬਰੈ ਬੀਨ ਬਾਲੰ ॥੪੮੬॥
transliteration: Choutte Baan Golan Outhe Agg Naalan|| Ghure Jaan Sayaamannd Ghataa Jim Jvaalan|| Nache Ees Seesan Puai Round Maalan|| Jujhe Beer Dhderan Darai Been Baalan||486||
translation: With the discharge of arrows, the firearms wre discharged like the fires rising in clourds; Shiva, dancing with his pleasure, strung the rosaries of skulls; the warriors began to fight and wed the heavenly damsels after selecting them.486.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੈ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗੰ ਭ੍ਰਮੰ ਰੁੰਡ ਮੁੰਡੰ ॥ ਗਜੀ ਬਾਜ ਗਾਜੀ ਗਿਰੈ ਬੀਰ ਝੁੰਡੰ ॥ ੲਿਕੰ ਹਾਕ ਹੰਕੈਤਿ ਧਰਕੈਤ ਸੂਰੰ ॥ ੳੂਠੇ ਤੱਛ ਮੁੱਛੰ ਭੲੀ ਲੋਹ ਪੂਰੰ ॥੪੮੭॥
transliteration: Girai An Bhanadg Bhramannd Round Mounndan|| Gadibaaj Gadjigirai Beer Jhoundan|| Ikan Haak Hankait(i) Dharkait Sooran|| Outhe Tchchh Mouchchhan Bhailoh Pooran||487||
translation: Getting truncated and having the limbs broken the riders of elephants, the horses and other warriors began to fall in groups; the hearts of the warriors throbbed with each challenge and with the rising of the fighters with beautiful whiskers the earth bec
